moves.1. e4 Nc6 2. Nf3 a5: Black opened his right flank to early!
moves.3. Bc4: White is getting ready for a major assault.
moves.7... Qe7: He saves his queen, but is forced to sacrifice his rook.
moves.8. Nxh8 Qc5 9. Bf7+: Black is in quite a predicament now.
moves.11. Bf5+: White does not want black to escape.
moves.12. Ng6+: Black is thinking oops, ouch, and ow!
moves.12... Kf7 13. Nh4 d6 14. d3 d5 15. Nc3 Q: The black queen is aimlessly wandering and dodging!
moves.17. c3 Qb5 18. a4 Qa6 19. Be3 dxe4 20. d: Black is now open to the white queens wrath! It's only a matter of time......before she strikes.
moves.20... g5 21. Bxc8 Rxc8 22. Nf3 Rd8 23. Q: Black attempts to distract white, but....
moves.25. Qxd3: ....fails. He now gets an opportunity to take white's queen!
moves.26. Nxd3 Nxe3: Black with a desperate effort to take a piece. He then takes white's bishop and gives his knight up.
moves.27. Rxe3: The game is completely in favor of white's victory!
moves.27... g4 28. Nfxe5+ Nxe5: Black gives up his other knight!
moves.29. Nxe5+ Ke6 30. Nxg4 Bc5 31. Rf3 b5 32: White is cleaning up all of black's pawn's now.
moves.32... bxa4 33. Rf7 a3: Black makes a dash to be queened...
